message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
Thanks for the offer, Alice! While I'm interested, $150 is a bit higher than my budget.  I'm willing to pay $110 for the product.  Let me know what you think.

Thanks for your offer, Bob! I understand that $150 might be a bit steep for you. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell the product to you for $130. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really love the product.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $130 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable with. How about we split the difference and settle on $125? It's a fair price for both of us, and I'm confident you'll still make a good profit.

I understand where you're coming from, Bob, but I'm not ready to go quite that low. I'm willing to meet you at $128, which is a bit closer to my minimum price. I think it's a fair compromise, and I'm confident you'll still be happy with the product.
Alice, I'm really trying to make this work, but I can't go any higher than $122. If we can agree on that, I'll take it. Otherwise, I'll have to look at other options.

I understand you're trying to make a deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $125. That's my minimum price, and I'm willing to hold firm. If you're willing to meet me at $125, I'm willing to make it happen.
